conclusion: Determine the refractive index based on the behavior of the light ray.
Light ray enters along axis OA and refracts at point C, undergoing total internal reflection.
Semi-cylindrical object has a radius R, point C is located at a distance of (sqrt(3)/3)R from O along the vertical diameter.
Critical angle for total internal reflection is given by theta_c = sin^(-1)(1/n).
Calculate angle of incidence using trigonometry: sin(theta_i) = (sqrt(3)/3)R/R = sqrt(3)/3.
Apply total internal reflection condition: sin(theta_i) = sqrt(3)/3 >= sin(theta_c) = 1/n.
Refractive index n must be at least sqrt(3) for total internal reflection at point C.
Final answer: refractive index of the transparent object is n = sqrt(3).
